metadata.title: CVE-2016-5300 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The XML parser in Expat does not use sufficient entropy for hashinitialization, which allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denialof service (CPU consumption) via crafted identifiers in an XML document.NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix forCVE-2012-0876.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5300` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.1.0-7ubuntu0.16.04.2
lib64expat1 - 2.1.0-7ubuntu0.16.04.2
libexpat1 - 2.1.0-7ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

tla - 1.3.5+dfsg-15
No subscription required

criterions.comment: expat package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-7ubuntu0.16.04.2').
xmlrpc-c package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
vnc4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
tla package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.5+dfsg-15').
